Similarly, the weak females also are divided into The two sub-divisions of stronger and weaker; Nga and ma with re-suffix are female and Nga and ma without re-suffix or With ’a ending are extremely female.

bar ma ma ning na ra la/ / yang 'jug yod dam med kyang rung / / ming gzhi pho yig mthar yod dang / / ming gzhi ma ning rjes su ni/ / yang 'jug dang bcas zhugs pa na/ / drag dang 'phrad pas drag par 'gyur/ /

Intermediate neutral na, ra, la, Affixed at the end of a name-base male letter Whether there is a re-suffix or not, and Affixed after a neutral name-base When there is a re-suffix, Are in contact with stronger, so change to stronger.
ming gzhi mo yig rjes su ni/ / yang 'jug med par zhugs pa na/ / zhan dang 'phrad pas zhan par 'gyur/ / de gnyis 'gyur ba ma ning yin/ /
Affixed after a name-base female letter When there is no re-suffix, They are in contact with weaker, so change to weaker. Those two are changeable neutral.
ming gzhi mo yig rjes su ni/ / yang 'jug dang bcas zhugs pa na/ / drag zhan gnyis ka'i cha ldan phyir/ / mtshan gnyis ma ning zhes su grags/ /
Affixed after a name-base female letter When there is a re-suffix, Because they have both stronger and weaker factors, They are known as “dual-character neutral”.
ming gzhi ma ning rjes su ni/ / yang 'jug med par zhugs pa na/ / drag zhan gang du'ang mi 'gyur bas/ / mtshan med ma ning zhes su 'dod/ /
Affixed after a name-base neutral name-base When there is no re-suffix, There is no change at all to stronger or weaker, So they are asserted to be “characterless neutral”.

gnyis pa don la gnyis yod pa'i/ / snga ma gang ltar 'gyur ba ni/ / rjes 'jug gang la zhugs pa yi/ / ming des bdag gzhan sogs gang ston/ / phal cher ming de'i sngon 'jug gi/ nus par sbyar nas rtogs par bya/ / phyi ma ji ltar 'gyur ba ni/ /

Second, meaning, has two parts of which How the prior one will change is concerned with What the name to which the suffix is joined Will come to show—self-other, and so on Which will usually be known through The capacity of the prefix joined to that name. How the subsequent one will be changed is as follows.
rjes 'jug pho yis pho yig gi/ ming mtha' gzhan drangs de bzhin du/ / mo yis mo yi ming mtha' dang / / ma ning gis ni ma ning drangs/ / de rnams rtags mtshungs 'dren tshul te/ /

Male suffix draws another male at the end of the name, Female draws a female at the end of the name, And neutral draws a neutral. Those ways are the ways of equivalent gender sign being drawn. There are also very many cases of ease of expression being drawn.
brjod bde 'dren pa'ang shin tu mang / / gzhan yang ming mtha' de nyid kyis/ / rtags mtshungs pa 'am sgra mthun pa'i/ / rnam dbye brgyad dang slar bsdu sogs/ / snga ma'i shugs dang mthun par 'dren/ /
Furthermore these items at the end of a name— The eight cases, the concluders, and so on With their equivalence of gender or their harmony of sound— Are drawn according to the force of the prior one.

de dag nang gses gang 'jug ni/ / rnam dbye'am 'phrad ces ming tshig de'i/ / mthar sbyar ming don las shes bya/ / de yang chos rnams ngo bo tsam/ / brjod pa rnam dbye dang po ste/ / dper na bum pa ka ba bzhin/ / gsal byed bod kyi skad la nyung / /

The particular division of what has been placed— Either a “case” or “linker”—can be known from the name equivalents resulting from the connection at The end of that name or and phrase. To explain further, case one expresses Just the entity of the dharmas; Its signifiers, for example like “pot” and “pillar”, Are few in the Tibetan language.
las dang bya yul don gcig ste/ / de lta'i bya ba'i yul zhig la/ / bya ba byas par ston pa la/ / gnyis pa las su bya ba dang / / gnyis pa'i nang tshan de nyid dang / /
Karma and place of action mean the same; Showing that some place of an action like that, Has had an action done to it, Is the second, the objective case and The second’s sub-division, identity.

bzhi pa dgos ched gsum 'dra yang / / bya ba byas pas bya ba'i yul/ / de 'am de dang 'brel ba la/ / phan thogs med na gnyis pa ste/ / dper na shar du 'gro lta bu/ / phan thogs yod na bzhi pa ste/ / dper na slong la sbyin lta bu/ /

It is like the fourth, purposiveness’s three but for A place of action that has had an action done to it Where that or what is connected with it Is not benefited, that is the second, For example, like “going to the east”. If there is benefit, it is the fourth, For example, like “giving to a beggar”.
phan thogs med kyang bya yul dang / / bya ba ngo bo gcig yin na/ / gnyis pa'i nang tshan de nyid de/ / dper na lha ru gsal lta bu/ /
Even if there is no benefit, if the place of action And the action are of the same entity, It is the second’s sub-division, identity, For example, like “appeared as the deity”.
gang zhig gang la brten pa 'am/ / gnas dang yod pa'i don tsam las/ / bya ba gtan nas mi byed na/ / rnam dbye bdun pa gnas gzhi ste/ / dper na steng du mi yod ltar/ /

If there is just the meaning of something which is relying on Or is positioned on or existing on something else And otherwise does no specific action, It is the seventh case, basis, For example, like “there is a man on top”.
tshe skabs gnyis dang don 'dra na/ / bdun pa'i nang tshan tshe skabs te/ / dper na mchu zla shar ba na/ / cho 'phrul dus chen tshugs lta bu/ /
If like the meaning of the second’s timings-circumstance, It is the seventh’s sub-division of time-circumstance, For example, when the Magha moon appears, The commemoration of miracles is undertaken.
rnam dbye gnyis bzhi bdun pa dang / / de nyid tshe skabs gsal byed sgra/ / su ra ru du na la tu/ / yin zhing phal cher la sgra dang / / mthun pas la don rnam dbye'ang zer/ /

The terms which elicit cases two, four, Seven, and timing-circumstance and identity Are su, ra, ru, du, na, la, tu, And given that they usually concur with the la term They are also called “the la-equivalent cases”.
'on kyang na la de nyid la/ / mi 'jug smra ba'i sgo las gsungs/ / rnam dbye gang la sbyor yul des/ / nye 'gyangs gang du bya ba zhig/ byas na gsum pa byed sgra ste/ / dper na bdag gis bshad lta bu/ /

Nevertheless, it says in the Speech Door That na and la are not placed for identity. If the place to which a case is connected, Does an action somewhere far or near, It is the third one, the agentive case, For example, “I explained”.
bya ba gtan nas mi byed par/ / snga phyi 'brel byed tsam ston na/ / rnam dbye drug pa 'brel sgra ste/ / dper na bdag gi mig lta bu/ /
If it definitely does no action and Shows just the making of a connection between former and later, It is the sixth case, connective term, For example, like “my eye”.
rnam dbye gsum drug gsal byed sgra/ / sa mtha' yod dang med pa yi/ / gi kyi gyi 'i yi lnga yin/ /
The terms which elicit the third and sixth cases Are the five gi, kyi, gyi, ’i, and yi With and without a sa ending respectively.
gang zhig gang las byung ba 'am/ / bye dang lhung ba'i don ldan na/ / rnam dbye lnga pa 'byung khungs te/ / dper na zhal nas thos lta bu/ /
If it has the meaning of something that arises from or, Comes out or issues forth from somewhere, It is the fifth case, source; For example, “heard from the mouth”.
gsal byed sgra ni nas las te/ / dgar dang sdud pa'ang lnga par gtogs/ /
The terms which elicit it are nas and las. Segregation and inclusion also are included in the fifth.
gzhan yang tshig don gong 'og tu/ / bsdu rgyu yod na sdud pa'i sgra/ / dang dang kyang yang 'ang sogs sbyor/ /
Furthermore, if the meanings of phrase equivalents Before and after are to be included, Dang, and kyang, yang, and ’ang, and so on are connected.
rnam grangs du mas don bskyar na/ / 'byed sdud sgra 'jug dgag pa dang / / bdag don yod na thog mtha' ru/ / pa sde'i rtags rnams ci rigs 'jug/

If several enumerations repeat the meaning, The separation-inclusion terms are affixed. If there are the meanings of negation or Of owner, then one of the gender signs of the pa section From beginning to end as appropriate is affixed.
rgyan du gyur pa'i tshig phrad kyang / / don la bsnyegs sa yod na sbyor/ / de bzhin bstan bya lhag yod na/ / lhag bcas sgra sbyor tshig don ni/ / rdzogs na slar bsdu'i sgra rnams sbyor/ /

Phrase linkers that become ornaments also Are connected if there is a follow-up to their meaning. Likewise, if there is extra to be shown, A continuative term is connected. When a phrase equivalent is complete, The concluder terms are connected.

dgos pa ci phyir 'jug ce na/ / mo yig dbyangs dang mi ldan na/ / pho yig gsal byed brjod mi nus/ / de phyir dbyangs lngar bzhed pa bde/ / pho yig dbyangs ldan de dag la'ang / / rjes 'jug bcu po ma zhugs na/ / don gyi ngo bo tsam ston pa'i/ / ming dang don gyi khyad par rnams/ / ston pa'i tshig dang don ldan pa'i/ / ngag gi brjod pa yod min te/ /

Why do they need to be affixed? If it is not associated with a female letter, a vowel, Then a male letter, a consonant, cannot be expressed. Therefore, it is convenient to assert five vowels. Moreover, for such male letters having a vowel, If it does not have one of the ten suffixes affixed, then The meaning carried by the names which show just the entity, and The distinctions of the names’ meaning shown by the phrases, and The verbal expressions that convey such meanings would not exist.

yi ge'i khongs nas ming dbyung zhing / / ming gi khongs nas tshig phyung nas/ / tshig gis don rnams ston pas so/ / ming tshig brjod pa med na ni/ / mthun mong mthun mong ma yin pa'i/ / shes bya ston pa'ang med par 'gyur/ / de phyir 'phags yul mkhas rnams kyi/ / rjes su 'brangs nas gsungs pa 'di/ / skye bo kun gyis rtogs gyur cig/

It is so, because names are drawn out from the letters, Phrases are drawn out from the names, And by phrases, the meanings are shown. If there were no names, phrases, or expressions, The teaching of ordinary and extraordinary Knowables also would become non-existent. Therefore may this, spoken following The Noble Land’s experts, Be realized by all beings.
tshig gi sgra tsam 'dra na yang / / don la khyad par shin tu che/ / de phyir brda dag la brten nas/ / ma nor don rnams 'tshol ba gces/ /

It seems like this is just a pile of terminology and words But an enormous meaning is distinguished within it. Rely on a correct understanding of language and Then stay with seeking out an un-mistaken meaning!
don la mi rmongs rmongs pa yang / / lugs 'dir mkhas min gyis byed de/ / sgra shes don la mi rmongs zhes/ / mkhas pa'i gsung la yongs su grags/ /
It is well-known that the experts say that anyone who Is not expert whether he is ignorant to the meaning or not, Who follows this approach will be someone who “Knowing terms has no ignorance”.

'di la ma sbyangs rmongs tshod kyis/ / 'chad rtsod rtsom pa'i grwar 'jug pa/ / wa skyes seng lpags gyon pa bzhin/ / nam zhig rjes ngan gsal bar 'gyur/ / de phyir blo gsal don gnyer rnams/ / rtags 'jug dka' gnad gzugs brnyan kun/ / gsal bar 'char ba'i me long 'dir/ / la 'ur gzigs mor spyon dang kye/ /

Anyone who has not learned the subject here and who is measure as being ignorant of it, Who enters an institution of exposition, debate, and composition, Will, like a fox in lion’s clothing Sooner or later be revealed. Therefore, you who seek a clear intellect, I say, “Hey! Come quick and look at the image In this mirror that clearly displays all reflections Of the difficult points of the Application of Gender Signs!”
'di la nongs pa'i tshogs mchis na/ / gzur gnas mkhas pa'i spyan sngar 'chags/ / cung zad 'bad las thob pa'i dges/ / kun gyis 'di don rtogs par shog / //
If errors have accumulated in here, They are confessed right here in view of the experts. By the virtue obtained from this small effort, May all comprehend the meaning of this.

ces rtags kyi 'jug pa'i snying po'i don mdo tsam brjod pa dka' gnad gsal ba'i me long zhes bya ba 'di ni/ rang gi slob bu rje drung sangs rgyas rgya mtsho dang don grub phun tshogs gnyis nas dgos tshul ltar/ mkhas mchog si tu paN chen dang thams cad mkhyen pa d+harma b+ha dra dpal bzang po'i bzhed pa dang mthun par dbyangs can grub pa'i rdo rjes sbyar ba'o// //

This “Mirror Which Reveals the Difficult Points”, A Short Statement of the Essential Meaning ofThe Application of Gender Signs was composed by Yangchen Drubpay Dorje according to the needs of my own students Jedrung Sangay Gyatso and Dondrup Phuntshog in accordance with the assertions of the supreme expert Situ Panchen and the All-knowing Dharmabhadra Palzangpo.

d.crumb: rigs lam gser gyi lde mig

f.d: @#/ / rtags 'jug dka' gnad gsal ba'i me long gi 'grel pa rigs lam gser gyi lde mig ces bya ba bzhugs so/ /
“A GOLDEN KEY TO KNOWLEDGE” COMMENTARY TO ‘A MIRROR THAT REVEALS THE DIFFICULT POINTS OF THE APPLICATION OF GENDER SIGNS’
by Yangchen Drubpay Dorje, translated by Tony Duff
@#/ / na mo many+dzu shrI ye/
Namo Mañjuśhrīye Homage to Mañjuśhrī
mkha' khyab shes bya yongs kyi gshis lugs chos/ / brjod bral 'gyur med dbyings su mngon gzigs pa/ / rgyal ba kun las bka' drin lhag pa'i mgon/ / dka' 'gyur chos kyi rgyal po gtsug na rgyal/ /

The dharma that is the inner character of all- pervading knowables in their entirety, Seen directly in the inexpressible, unchanging expanse, Is the guardian who kindness is even more than all the conquerors, The conqueror at the crown of the kings of dharma who show the word.
dus gsum rgyal ba'i ye shes ma lus pa/ / gcig bsdus rang gzugs smra ba ngag gi lha/ / brgyad gnyis lang tsho'i 'jo sgeg gar rtsen pa/ / 'jam dpal rdo rje rnon pos dge legs stsol/ /

This, every wisdom without exception of the conquerors of the three times, Condensed into one, the self-form of expression, the deity of speech, Who plays with the beguiling dance of two eights’ youth: Mañjuśhrī Vajratikṣhṇa, please bestow goodness and virtue”.
brgyad khri bzhi stong chos tshul tam bu ra'i/ / sgra las drangs pa'i dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor kun/ / skal bzang thos 'dzin dpyid du 'jo mdzad ma/ / sgra ldan lha kye snying la rol par mdzod/ /
The melody of all maṇçalas which comes forth like A tamboura giving the eighty-four thousand dharmas, The beautiful lady so delightful for the fortunate to hear, Devi of sounds, Oh, play in my heart!
dbyangs can thugs la grub pa'i rdo rje yi/ / zab yangs blo gros mtho ris skyed tshal las/ / legs 'ongs rtags 'jug pad+ma 'dzum pa'i zhal/ / rnam dpyod nyin byed snang bas dbye bar bya/ /

The vajra of profound and vase intellect come about in Sarasvati’s mind, Is the pleasure garden of the higher estates and within it, The nicely-made but closed lotus of the Application of Gender Signs Will be opened by the appearance of the sun of fine analysis.
kwa ye blo gsal rkang drug gzhon nu rnams/ / brda dag sbrang rtsi'i dga' ston spyod 'dod na/ / legs bshad me tog kha sgo phye ba'i dus/ / dga' ba'i glu dbyangs dang bcas zhugs par rigs/ /

Hey! You six-legged, youthful ones of clear intellect If you would like to enjoy the feast of honey of pure signs of language When the mouth, the doorway, of the flower of elegant explanations opens It’s right that you should be inside with melodious songs of joy!

de la 'dir snyigs dus kyi paN+Di ta chen po dngul chu dbyangs can grub pa'i rdo rje dpal bzang pos mdzad pa'i legs bshad rmad du byung ba rtags 'jug dka' gnad gsal ba'i me long 'di nyid sa bcad rgyas pa sogs dor nas mdor bsdus su 'chad pa la gsum/

Now, for the main presentation. There is the amazingly clear presentation by the great paṇçita of the degenerate times, Ngulchu Yangchen Drubpay Dorje Palzangpo, called A Mirror that Reveals the Difficult Points of the “Application of Gender Signs”. When the extensive divisions into topics of that text are left out and it is explained in a summarized form, there are just three main headings:
mchod brjod/ brtsam par dam bca'/ gzhung don dngos so/ /
I. Expression of Worship II. Declaration of Composition III. Actual Text
dang po [mchod brjod]
I. Expression of worship
mchod brjod la yang rgya skad dang bod skad gnyis las
The expression of worship has two parts since it is done via both Indian and Tibetan languages.
dang po rgya skad kyi sgo nas mchod brjod ni/
—Via Indian language
na mo many+dzu shrI ye/
“Namo Mañjuśhrīye”

zhes pa/ byang phyogs kha ba can pa stod mnga' ris skor gsum rdzing bu lta bu/ bar dbus gtsang ru bzhi yur ba lta bu/ smad mdo khams sgang drug zhing sa dang 'dra bar yod la/ de la yang bod dang bod chen po gnyis las bod dbus gtsang gi skad du/ na mo phyag 'tshal lo/ / many+dzu 'jam/ shrI dpal/ ye la ste/ 'jam dpal la phyag 'tshal lo/ /zhes pa'o/ /

There is the northern snowy place with its various parts: the reservoir-like Tripartite Ngari Region to the east; the aqueduct-like four-sectioned U Tsang in the centre; and the field-like six- highlands of Do Kham to the West. It is also divided into Tibet and Greater Tibet and of the two, in the language of Tibet, which is U Tsang: “namo” is “phyag tshal lo”, “mañju” is “’jam”, “śhrī” is dpal, and “ye” is “la” in other words, “jam pal la chag tsal lo”. In English: “namo” is “homage”, “mañju” is “gentle”, “śhrī” is “glory” and “ye” is “to”, in other words, “Homage to Mañjuśhrī”.
gnyis pa bod skad kyi sgo nas mchod par brjod pa ni/
—Via Tibetan language
rgyal kun mkhyen pa'i ye shes dpyid/ / gzhon nu'i gzugs kyis rnam rol ba/ / rje btsun brtan pa'i 'khor lo dang / / dbyer med bla ma'i zhabs btud nas/ /
“I bow at the feet of the guru who is inseparable from The delight of the wisdom knowledge of all conquerors Sporting in the youthful form of Jetsun Tenpa’i Khorlo.”

zhes pa/ rab 'byams rgyal ba kun gyi mkhyen rab kyi ye shes gcig tu bsdus pa'i dpyid de snying po/ gzhon nu na tshod bcu drug lon pa'i gzugs kyis rnam par rol pa/ rje btsun brtan pa'i 'khor lo ste 'jam dpal dbyangs dang ngo bo dbyer med pa rang la mngon mtho dang nges legs kyi lam ma nor bar ston pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa d+harma b+ha dra sogs dngos brgyud bla ma rnams kyi zhabs kyi pad+mo la sgo gsum gus pa chen pos btud nas/ zhes pa'o/ /

This is saying, “The essence of that delight which is the condensation into one place of the utter knowledge of the wisdom of all the conquerors of the universes, sporting in the youthful, sixteen-year old form, is Jetsun Tenpa’i Khorlo that is, Mañjuśhrīghoṣha. I bow with my three doors with great reverence at the lotus feet of the actual and lineage gurus, Dharmabhadra and so on, the omniscient ones who un-mistakenly show paths to the higher rebirths and definite goodness and who are inseparable with Jetsun Tenpa’i Khorlo.”
gnyis pa brtsam par dam bca' ni/
II. Declaration of Composition
mkhas mchog thon mi'i thugs mtsho las/ / byung ba'i brda sprod phyi mo mchog/ rtags kyi 'jug pa'i snying po'i don/ / mdor bsdus tshig gis gsal bar bya/ /

“The essential meaning of “The Application of Gender Signs”, The supreme grandmother of grammars that came from The ocean of the mind of the supreme expert Thonmi, Will be made clear here in summary form.”

zhes pa/ gangs can sA la'i sman ljongs 'dir mkhas grub nam mkha'i skar tshogs ltar byon pa rnams kyi nang nas mchog tu gyur pa thon mi nyid kyi thugs kyi rgya mtsho chen po las byung ba'i yul gangs can gyi skad kyi brda sprod pa'i bstan bcos kun gyi phyi mo'am ma phyi'am gzhi'am rtsa ba mchog tu gyur pa sum rtags gnyis las rtags kyi 'jug pa'i snying po'i don rnams ma tshang ba med par mdor bsdus pa'i tshig gi sgo nas gsal bar bya/ zhes pa'o/ /

This is saying, “Constellations of learned and accomplished ones have come to this snowy region, a place of medicinal and fragrant Sāla, and of them, the supreme one is Thonmi himself. Of all the treatises of the grammar of the snowy land that came from the great ocean of his mind, the ones that became the grandmothers of all others, the original ones, the bases, or the roots were The Thirty and Gender Signs. Of these, the essential meanings of the Application of Gender Signs will be made clear in words that are brief but leave nothing out.”
gsum pa gzhung don dngos ni/
III. Actual Text
1. The explanation of the overall divisions of gender signs of the name-base letters
spyir na dbyangs mo gsal byed pho/ / de phyir kA li sum cu po/ /
“Overall vowels are female and consonants male. Therefore, the thirty kāli as a whole …”

zhes pa/ ming gzhi'i yi ge spyi'i rtags kyi dbye ba bshad pa ste/ spyir yi ge la dbye na dbyangs dang gsal byed gnyis su yod/ de las dbyangs kyi bya ba gsal bar mtshon par byed pa/ i ste gi gu/ u ste zhabs kyu/ e ste 'greng bu/ o ste rna ru bzhi ni mo dang / kA li'i bya ba gsal bar byed pa'i ka nas a'i bar gyi yi ge sum cu po rnams ni phor shes par bya'o/ /zhes pa'o/ /

This is saying, “Overall, when letters are categorized, there are two types: vowels and consonants. Of them, the marks that distinguish the function of the vowels—the four of the gigu for i, zhabskyu for u, grengbu for e, and naru for o—are understood to be female and the distinguishers of the kāli, the thirty letters from ka to a, are understood to be male.”
pho yi yi ge 'ba' zhig la/ / nang gses sde tshan lngar dbye ste/ /
“Are male letters only and they Are sub-divided into five sets.”

zhes pa/ pho yig sum cu po de rnams nang gses sde tshan so sor dbye na lngar 'gyur te/ lnga gang zhe na/ pho dang / ma ning dang / mo dang / shin tu mo dang / mo gsham ste lngar 'gyur ro/ / 'ba' zhig ni kho na zhes pa'i don no/ / de lnga'i dang po pho ni/

If the male letters, which are those thirty consonants, are then divided up into the groups that are their sub-divisions, there are five of them. What are the five? They are: male, neutral, female, extremely female, and barren. The term “only” has the meaning “exclusively”. The first ones of the first five groups are the males:
ka ca ta pa tsa rnams pho/ /
“ka, ca, ta, pa, tsa are male.”
zhes pa/ ka dang / ca dang / ta dang / pa dang / tsa bcas lnga po de rnams pho yig go/ gnyis pa ma ning ni/
The five letters ka, ca, ta, pa, and tsa together are male letters. The second ones are the neutrals:
kha cha tha pha tsha ma ning / /
“Kha, cha, tha, pha, tsha are neutral.”
zhes pa/ kha dang / cha dang / tha dang / pha dang / tsha bcas lnga ni ma ning gi yi ge 'o/ / gsum pa mo ni/
The five letters kha, cha, tha, pha, and tsha together are the neutral letters. Third,
ga ja da ba dza wa zha/ / za 'a ya sha sa rnams mo/ /
“ga, ja, da, ba, dza, wa, zha za, ’a, ya, sha, sa are female.”
zhes pa/ ga dang / ja dang / da dang / ba dang / dza dang / wa dang / zha dang / za dang / 'a dang / ya dang / sha dang / sa bcas bcu gnyis po 'di rnams mo yig go/ bzhi pa shin tu mo ni/
The twelve letters ga, ja, da, ba, dza, wa, zha, za, ’a, ya, sha, and sa together are the female letters. Fourth, the extremely female ones:
nga nya na ma shin tu mo/ /
“nga, nya, na, ma are extremely female.”
zhes pa/ nga dang / nya dang / na dang / ma bcas bzhi po shin tu mo'i yi ge'o/ / lnga pa mo gsham gyi yi ge ni/
The four letters nga, nya, na, and ma together are the extremely female letters. Fifth, the barren letters:
ra la ha a mo gsham ste/ /
“ra, la, ha, aa, are barren and ….”
zhes pa/ ra dang / la dang / ha dang / a dang bcas bzhi ni mo gsham gyi yi ge'o/ /
The four letters ra, la, ha, and a together are the barren letters.
a ni mtshan med ces kyang bya/ /
“aa is also named “characterless”.”
zhes pa/ a ni mo gsham gyi yi ge yin par ma zad/ sgra rtsol shin tu zhan pas mtshan med ces kyang bya ba ste zer ba yin no/ /zhes pa'o/ /
which is saying, “aa is not only a barren letter but since it has a sound effort that is extremely weak it is also named, that is, called, “characterless””.
2. The explanation of the divisions of the gender signs of the prefixes
sngon 'jug lnga yi ba yig pho/ /
“Of the five prefixes, letter ba is male …”

zhes pa/ sngon 'jug gi rtags kyi dbye ba bshad pa ste/ rang gi 'jug yul du gyur pa'i ming gzhi'i sngon du 'jug pa'i sngon 'jug lnga ni/ legs bshad ljon dbang las/ ga da ba ma 'a sngon 'jug/ ces pa ltar sngon 'jug lnga po de'i nang nas ba yig ni pho yin no/ /
Five letters are pre-affixed to their own, recipient name-bases: as it says in The Fine Explanation of the Great Tree, “ga, da, ba, ma, ’a are prefixes”. Of the five prefixes, the ba letter is male.
ga da ma ning /
“ga and da are neutral, and ”
zhes pa/ ga da gnyis sngon 'jug gi ma ning dang /
Both ga and da are neutral prefixes and
'a mo yig/
“’a is female”
ces pa/ 'a ni mo dang /
’a is a female letter”
ma ni shin tu mo yin no/ /
ma is extremely female
zhes pa/ ma ni shin tu mor 'gyur ba yin no/ /
comes to mean that ma is extremely female.
3. The explanation of the affixation of the gender signs of the prefixes
de rnams gang la gang 'jug na/ /
“For those, which is affixed to which?”
zhes pa/ sngon 'jug gi rtags kyi 'jug pa bshad pa ste/ gong du bshad pa'i yi ge de rnams ming gzhi'i yi ge gang la sngon 'jug gang 'jug ce na/
For those letters explained above, which prefix is affixed to which name-base letter?
pho yig ba ni ka ca ta/ / tsa ga nga ja nya da na/ / dza zha za ra sha sar 'jug/
“Male letter ba is affixed to ka, cha, ta tsa, ga, nga, ja, nya, da, na, dza, zha, za, ra, sha, and sa.”

ces pa/ sngon 'jug gi pho yig ba ni/ ka dang / ca dang / ta dang / tsa dang / ga dang / nga dang / ja dang / nya dang / da dang / na dang / dza dang / zha dang / za dang / ra dang / sha dang / sa bcas yi ge bcu drug po 'di rnams la 'jug cing /
The prefix male letter ba is affixed to these, sixteen letters: ka, cha, ta, tsa, ga, nga, ja, nya, da, na, dza, zha, za, ra, sha, and sa. And, it is affixed to letter:
ka la rkyang brtsegs 'dogs gsum gyi sgo nas 'jug pa ni/ dper na/ bka'/ bska/ bkye/ bkra/ bskyangs/ ca la rkyang 'phul kho nas 'jug pa dper na/ bcas/ bcom/ bcug/

lta bu/ ta la rkyang brtsegs gnyis kyis 'jug ste dper na/ btab/ btud/ btags/ brtags/ blta/ bstar/ lta bu/ tsa la rkyang brtsegs kyis 'jug pa ni/ btsal/ btsos/ btsugs/ brtsegs/ lta bu/ ga la rkyang 'dogs brtsegs gsum gyis 'jug pa ni/ bgo/ bgrad/ bgyis/ brgal/ bsgoms/ lta bu/ nga la brtsegs 'phul kho nas 'jug pa ni/ brngams/ bsngags/ lta bu/ ja la brtsegs 'phul kho nas 'jug pa/ brjes/ brjid/ lta bu/ nya la brtsegs 'phul kho nas/ brnyan/ bsnyen/ lta bu/ da la rkyang brtsegs gnyis kyis 'jug pa ni/ bde/ brda/ bldag/ bsdad/ lta bu/ na la brtsegs 'phul kho nas/ brnag/ bsnams/ lta bu/ dza la brtsegs 'phul kho nas 'jug pa ni/ brdzes/ brdzis/ lta bu/ zha la rkyang 'phul/ bzhag/ bzhi/ bzhes/ lta bu/ za la rkyang 'dogs gnyis/ dper na/ bzang / bzi/ bzung / bzed/ bzo/ bzlas/ lta bu/ ra la 'dogs 'phul kho nas 'jug pa ni/ brlabs/ lta bu/ sha la rkyang 'phul kho nas 'jug pa ni/ dper na/ bshad/ bshes/ lta bu/ sa la rkyang 'dogs gnyis kyis 'jug pa/ bsam/ bsu/ bse/ bsos/ bsris/ bsrungs/ bsres/ bsros/ bslab/ lta bu/
ma ning ga ni ca ta tsa/ / nya da na zha za ya sha/ sar 'jug/
“Neutral ga is affixed to ca, ta, tsa, nya, da, na, zha, za, ya, sha, And sa. …”

ces pa/ sngon 'jug gi ma ning ga ni ming gzhi'i/ ca dang / ta dang / tsa dang / nya dang / da dang / na dang / zha dang / za dang / ya dang / sha dang / sa bcas bcu gcig la rkyang 'phul kho nas 'jug pa ni/ gcod/ gter/ gtso/ gnyen/ gdong/ gnad/ gzhal/ gzigs/ g.yang / gshegs/ gsung / lta bu/

The prefix neutral ga is affixed to the eleven name-bases ca, ta, tsa, nya, da, na, zha, za, ya, sha, and sa only as a fronting to the bare letter as in གཅོད། གཏེར། གཙོ། གཉེན། གདོང་། གནད། གཞལ། གཟིགས། གཡང་། གཤེགས། གསུང་།.
ma ning da yig ni/ / ka pa ga ba nga mar 'jug/
“… Neutral da letter is affixed to ka, pa, ga, ba, nga, and ma.”

ces pa/ sngon 'jug gi ma ning da yig ni ming gzhi'i/ ka dang / pa dang / ga dang / ba dang / nga dang / ma bcas drug po 'di rnams la 'jug cing / de yang nga la rkyang 'phul dang gzhan lnga la rkyang 'dogs gnyis te/ dper na/ dkar/ dkyil/ dkrigs/ dpal/ dpral/ dpyid/ dga'/ dgra/ dgyes/ dbang / dbri/ dbyibs/ dngul/ dma'/ dmigs/ dmyal/ lta bu/

The prefix neutral da letter is affixed to these six name-bases ka, pa, ga, ba, nga, and ma. Moreover, it is affixed to nga only as a fronting to the bare letter and to the other five both bare and sub-fixed as in དཀར། དཀྱིལ། དཀྲིགས། དཔལ། དཔྲལ། དཔྱིད། དགའ། དགྲ། དགྱེས། དབང་། དབྲི། དབྱིབས། དངུལ། དམའ། དམིགས། དམྱལ།.
mo yig 'a ni ga ja da/ / ba dza kha cha tha pha tshar/ /
“Female letter ’a is affixed to ga, ja, da, ba, dza, kha, cha, tha, pha, and tsha”

zhes pa/ ga dang / ja dang / da dang / ba dang / dza dang / kha dang / cha dang / tha dang / pha dang / tsha bcas bcu po la mo yig 'a 'jug pa las/ ga la rkyang 'dogs gnyis kyis 'jug pa ni/ 'ga'/ 'gro/ 'gyel/ ja la rkyang 'phul ni/ 'jal/ da la rkyang 'dogs kyi dpe ni/ 'dab/ 'di/ 'dra/ ba la rkyang 'dogs dper na/ 'ba'/ 'brog/ 'byor/ dza la rkyang 'phul ni/ 'dzer/ 'dzum/ 'dzol/ kha la rkyang 'dogs/ 'khor/ 'khrul/ 'khri/ 'khyir/ cha la rkyang 'phul/ 'chad/ 'chang / 'char/ tha la rkyang 'phul/ 'thob/ pha la rkyang 'dogs/ 'phar/ 'phreng / 'phyi/ tsha la rkyang 'phul/ 'tshal/ lta bu/
shin tu mo yi ma yig ni/ / kha cha tha tsha ga ja da/ / dza nga nya na rnams la 'jug/
“And extremely female letter ma to kha, cha, tha, tsha, ga, ja, da, dza, nga, nya, and na.”

ces pa/ sngon 'jug gi shin tu mo ma yig ni ming gzhi'i/ kha dang / cha dang / tha dang / tsha dang / ga dang / ja dang / da dang / dza dang / nga dang / nya dang / na bcas bcu gcig la 'jug pa'i kha ga gnyis la rkyang 'dogs dang / gzhan ma rkyang 'phul dper na/ mkha'/ mkhris/ mkhyen/ mchis/ mthong / mtshungs/ mgon/ mgrin/ mgyogs/ mjal/ mda'/ mdzod/ mnga'/ mnyam/ mnan/ lta bu/

The prefix extremely female ma letter is affixed to the eleven name- bases kha, cha, tha, tsha, ga, ja, da, dza, nga, nya, and na. Of them, it is affixed to both kha and ga bare and sub-joined and to the others fronted to the bare letter e.g., མཁའ། མཁྲིས། མཁྱེན། མཆིས། མཐོང་། མཚུངས། མགོན། མགྲིན། མགྱོགས། མཇལ། མདའ། མཛོད། མངའ། མཉམ། མནན།.
ji ltar 'jug par byed ce na/ / pho ni sgra rtsol drag par 'jug/ ma ning ran par 'jug pa yin/ / mo ni zhan pa'i tshul gyis te/ / shin tu mo ni mnyam pas so/ /

zhes pa/ sgra rtsol dang mthun pa'i sgo nas ji ltar 'jug par byed pa yin nam zer na/ sngon 'jug gi pho ba ni rang gi 'jug yul ming gzhi'i ye ge rnams la sgra ste skad gdangs che ba dang / rtsol ba zhes pa dbugs la sogs pa'i rtsol ba shin tu che bas sgra rtsol drag par 'jug pa dang / ma ning ga da gnyis ni sgra rtsol cha snyoms ran pa ste 'tshams par 'jug pa dang / mo 'a yig ni sgra rtsol zhan pa ste chung ba'i tshul gyis 'jug pa dang / shin tu mo ma yig ni sgra rtsol mo las kyang shin tu zhan pas na mnyam pas so zhes pa'o/ /

This is saying, “If you ask, “How are do they become affixed in relation to sound effort?”, then there is this explanation. The prefix male ba, affixed to its own recipient name-base letters has a pronounced that is, spoken sound, that is greater, and an effort where effort refers to the efforts of breath and so on, that is extremely great, hence it is affixed to give a stronger sound effort. The neutral two ga and da are affixed to give a sound effort that is of equal parts and so moderate that is, balanced in between. The female ’a letter is affixed to a sound effort that is done in a weaker that is, a lesser way. The extremely female ma letter has a sound effort that is weaker again than the female, extremely weak, so it is affixed in flat way.”
ci phyir 'jug par byed ce na/ /
“Why is the affixing done?”
zhes pa/ sngon 'jug lnga po de rnams 'jug yul ming gzhi'i ye ge rnams la dgos pa ci phyir 'jug par byed ce na/
What is the necessity behind affixing those five prefixes to their recipient name-base letters that is, why is it done?

thog mar 'di ltar shes dgos te/ / las gang zhig la byed pa po/ / gzhan dang dngos su 'brel ba yi/ / dbang du byas nas byed po dang / / de yi byed pa gnyis po ni/ / dngos po bdag yin bya yul dang / / bya ba gnyis po dngos po gzhan/ /

“To begin with, this has to be understood: From the standpoint of an agent In actual relationship to a karma as other, The two of agent and its instrument Are the self thing and the two of place of action And action are the other thing.”

zhes pa/ sngon 'jug gi ci phyir 'jug gi gzhung don zhib tu shes pa la thog mar 'di ltar shes par byed dgos te/ las sam bya yul la bya ba zhig byed rgyu yod na bdag gzhan dus gsum gyi dbye ba 'jug la/ las sam bya yul la bya ba byed rgyu med na bdag gzhan dus gsum gyi dbye ba mi 'jug/

In order to come to a fine understanding of the treatise’s meaning that is explained under the heading “Why is the affixing of the prefixes done?”, it is necessary at first to understand this. If a karma that is, an object of an action, has some action that is to be done to it, then the distinctions of self-other and the three tenses are engaged; and if there is no karma, that is, no object of an action that has some action that is to be done to it, then the distinctions of self- other and the three tenses are not engaged.

de la byed po gzhan dang dngos su 'brel ba'i dbang du byas nas byed po gang zag dang de'i byed pa ni shing gcod pa lta bur mtshon na sta re yin pas de gnyis ni/ bdag gzhan gnyis kyi nang nas bdag yin/ des bsgrub par bya ba'i yul gyi dngos po dang bya ba gnyis po ni bdag gzhan gnyis kyi nang nas gzhan yin/ de yang bya ba'i yul gyi dngos po ni shing yin/ bya ba ni shing gcod pa'i las ka sta re'i 'degs 'jog dang shing dum bur btub pa sogs yin/

In regard to that, from the standpoint of the agent being in actual relationship with an other there is the following. Both the agent and the instrument that it uses to do the action are, out of the two possibilities of self and other, self, and if we use a person who cuts wood to illustrate this, then the agent is the person and the instrument used to do the action is the axe. Both the thing which is the place of the action carried out by them and the action that will be carried out by them are, out of the two possibilities of self and other, other. Moreover, the thing which is the place of the action is the wood and the action is the work of cutting the wood: the chopping of the axe; the splitting of the wood into pieces; and so on.

dpe brjod kyi skabs su/ shing gcod pa po/ shing gcod po/ zhes pa'i sgra 'di lta bus byed po gang zag shing mkhan go bas bdag gzhan gnyis nas bdag yin/ gcod par byed/ gcod do/ / lta bu byed las gsal byed kyi sgra zer ba yin no/ / don du byed pa sta re dang de 'degs pa'i bya ba go dgos/ bdag gzhan gnyis nas de yang bdag yin/ gcad bya/ gcad par bya ba/ gcad bya'i shing / lta bu 'di rnams tshig brjod tshul mi 'dra ba byung yang don gcig cing bya yul gsal byed kyi sgra zer ba yin/ 'di skabs bya yul shing go dgos shing bdag gzhan gnyis nas gzhan yin/ gcad par bya/ gcad do/ /lta bu 'di rnams la bya ba'i yul dang 'brel ba'i bya ba gsal byed kyi sgra zer ba yin/ 'di skabs sta re 'degs pa'i bya ba shing gi steng du babs nas shing bkas pa dang dum bur 'gro ba sogs go dgos shing bdag gzhan gnyis nas gzhan yin/

In the case of our example, terms like ཤིང་གཅོད་པ་པོ། ཤིང་གཅོད་པོ། “the one who cuts wood” produce the understanding of the agent, a person who cuts wood and thereby, out of the two self and other, it is self. Terms like གཅོད་པར་བྱེད། གཅོད་དོ། “cutting” are called “the term that distinguishes the verb function”. The instrument that in fact does that work, the axe, and its action of chopping up and down are to be understood, out of the two self and other, also as self. Various different expressions like གཅད་བྱ། གཅད་པར་བྱ་བ། གཅད་བྱའི་ཤིང་། “that to be cut”, “what will be cut”, “the wood to be cut” appear but have the same meaning and are called “terms that distinguish the place of the action”. In this case, the place of the action is understood to be the wood and out of the two, self and other, is other. Terms like གཅད་པར་བྱ། གཅད་དོ། “will be cut” are called “terms that distinguish the action connected with the place of the action”. In this case, it is understood as the axe’s action of chopping having actually happened on the wood with the result that wood has split and gone to pieces, etcetera, and out of the two, self and other, is other.
bdag gzhan gnyis kyi dbye ba de ltar blo la bzhag nas/ dus gsum gyi dbye ba ni/
After that kind of distinction between self and other has been grasped conceptually, then there is the division into three tenses.
de bzhin byed pa po gzhan dang / / dngos su 'brel min ji ltar yang / / bya ba byas zin 'das pa dang / / bya ba byed 'gyur ma 'ongs dang / / byed bzhin pa ni da lta ba/ /

“No matter how it is—whether there is agent as other like that Or there is no actual relationship—still, that The action has been done is past, The action will be done is future, and The action is being done is present.”

zhes pa/ gong du bdag gzhan so sor dbye ba de bzhin du byed pa po gzhan dang dngos su 'brel yang rung / ma 'brel yang rung ji ltar yin na yang / bya ba byas zin pa ni 'das pa dang / dper na/ lha bsgrubs/ shing bcad/ lta bu dang / bya ba byed 'gyur ni ma 'ongs pa dper na/ lha bsgrub/ bsgrub par bya/ bsgrub bya/ bsgrub par bya ba/ bsgrub bya'i lha/ gcad bya/ gcad par bya ba/ gcad par bya/ gcad do/ / gcad bya'i shing / 'di rnams dus gsum nas dus ma 'ongs pa yin/ bya ba byed bzhin pa da ltar ba ni dper na/ lha sgrub/ sgrub bo/ / sgrub bzhin pa/ sgrub kyin 'dug/ sgrub par byed/ sgrub byed/ shing gcod par byed/ gcod do/ / gcod byed/ gcod bzhin pa/ gcod kyin 'dug/ lta bu 'di rnams da lta ba yin/

In regard to the above division into self and other, regardless of how it is—whether it is like that with the agent in actual relationship to other or is not—still, the action will be past, present, or future. If the action has been done, it is the past, e.g., ལྷ་བསྒྲུབས། “accomplished the deity”, ཤིང་བཅད། “cut the wood”; if the action will be done, it is future e.g., all of these are examples of the future of the three tenses, ལྷ་བསྒྲུབ། “will accomplish the deity”, བསྒྲུབ་པར་བྱ། “will be accomplished”, བསྒྲུབ་བྱ། “that to be accomplished”, བསྒྲུབ་བྱའི་ལྷ། “deity that will be accomplished”, གཅད་བྱ། “that to be cut”, གཅད་པར་བྱ་བ། “will be cut (but with a noun like sense)”, གཅད་པར་བྱ། “will be cut”, གཅད་དོ། “will be cut”, གཅད་བྱའི་ཤིང་། “wood that will be cut”; and if the action is being done, it is the present e.g., these are the present, ལྷ་སྒྲུབ། “accomplishing the deity”, སྒྲུབ་བོ། “accomplishing”, སྒྲུབ་བཞིན་པ། “is accomplishing“, སྒྲུབ་ཀྱིན་འདུག “is accomplishing”, སྒྲུབ་པར་བྱེད། “accomplishing”, སྒྲུབ་བྱེད། “accomplisher”, ཤིང་གཅོད་པར་བྱེད། “cutting wood”, གཅོད་དོ། “cutting”, གཅོད་བྱེད། “cutter”, གཅོད་བཞིན་པ། “cutting“, གཅོད་ཀྱིན་འདུག “cutting”.

yang bya byed las gsum zer rgyu 'di ngos 'dzin yag po shes dgos pas/ gcod po dang / sgrub pa po/ lta bu 'di rnams bya byed las gsum gyi nang nas byed pa yin/ gcod par byed/ gcad par bya/ gcad do/ / sgrub par byed/ bsgrub par bya/ bsgrub bo/ /lta bu bya byed las gsum gyi nang nas bya ba yin/ gcad bya/ gcad par bya ba/ gcad bya'i shing / bsgrub bya/ bsgrub par bya ba/ bsgrub bya'i lha/ lta bu 'di rnams bya byed las gsum gyi nang nas las zer ba de yin te/ bstan bcos 'di yi gsham du/ las dang bya yul don gcig ste/ /zhes gsungs pa'i phyir/

Further, there is the slogan “the three—action, agent, and karma”. Each item in it must be identified and the whole understood well, therefore the following is given. Terms like གཅོད་པོ། སྒྲུབ་པ་པོ། “the cutter” and “the accomplisher” are, out of the three—action, agent, and karma—the agent. Terms like གཅོད་པར་བྱེད། གཅད་པར་བྱ། གཅད་དོ། སྒྲུབ་པར་བྱེད། བསྒྲུབ་པར་བྱ། བསྒྲུབ་བོ། “is cutting”, “will be cut”, “will cut”, “is accomplishing”, “will be accomplished”, “will accomplish”, are, out of the three—action, agent, and karma—what is called “the action”. Terms like གཅད་བྱ། གཅད་པར་བྱ་བ། གཅད་ བྱའི་ཤིང།། བསྒྲུབ་བྱ། བསྒྲུབ་པར་བྱ་བ། བསྒྲུབ་བྱའི་ལྷ། “that to be cut”, “what will be cut”, “the wood to be cut”, “that to be accomplished”, “the deity to be accomplished” are, out of the three—action, agent, and karma—what is called “the karma”; this is so because further down in this treatise it says, “Karma and place of action mean the same.”

yang byed pa la gtso phal gnyis yod pas gcod pa po shing gcod mkhan gang zag de gtso bo yin/ gcod byed sta re phal pa yin/ shing gcad pa bya ba yin cing de la byed pa po la yod pa'i bya ba dang / bya ba'i yul la yod pa'i bya ba gnyis yod de/ sta res shing gcod pa'i rtsol ba ni byed pa po shing mkhan la yod cing de gsal byed kyi sgra ni/ gcod par byed zer ba 'di yin/ shing dum bur bcad pa'i cha ni bya yul shing gi steng du yod cing de gsal byed kyi sgra ni/ gcad do/ / gcad par bya/ zhes pa 'di yin no/ / 'di skabs mkhas pa so so'i bzhed tshul mi 'dra ba mang po 'dug kyang rang lugs 'di ltar 'thad par sems so/ /

Further, the doer has two parts, principal and complement: the གཅོད་པ་པོ་ agent who cuts, the person who is a woodcutter, is the principal, and the གཅོད་བྱེད་ cutter, the axe, is the complement. Then, the action is that the wood will be cut and in regard to that there is both the action belonging to the agent and the action belonging to the place of the action. The effort of the axe cutting the wood belongs to the agent, the woodsman, and the term that distinguishes that is གཅོད་པར་བྱེད་ “cutting”. The part that the wood has been cut into pieces belongs to the place of the action, the wood, and the term that distinguishes it is གཅད་དོ། གཅད་པར་བྱ། “the cutting that will happen”. There are many different ways of assertion for this, each expert having his own way, but I think that this one, which is our system, is agreeable.

yang gong du dngos po bdag yin zhes pa'i dngos po de rtags 'jug rtsa ba na dngos su gsungs med pas gsar bu ba rnams la ma sbyar na re zhig go bde zhing / dngos po dang dngos can gyi dngos po de yin zer ba gu dog 'ba' zhig go/

Then, the “thing” mentioned above in “is the self thing”, is not explicitly mentioned in the root text Application of Gender Signs so understanding will be easier for newcomers if it is not brought up for a while. And then the so-called “thing which is comprised of both thing and having a thing” is nothing but narrowness.
de phyir dus gsum dbye bas ni/ / byed las dang 'brel ngag gi ni/ / sbyor ba kun la khyab pa yin/ /
“Therefore, the distinction of three tenses Pervades all spoken constructs Related to verb function.”

zhes pa/ rgyu mtshan de'i phyir dus gsum gyi dbye bas ni byed las dang 'brel ba'i ngag gi sbyor ba thams cad la khyab pa yin/ zhes pa'o/ / de yang go bde bar brjod na byed las dang 'brel ba'i ngag yin tshad thams cad yang na dus 'das pa yin dgos/ yang na dus ma 'ongs pa yin dgos/ yang na da lta ba yin dgos/ zhes pa'i don no/ /

This is saying, “For that reason, the distinction into three tenses pervades every spoken construct that is related to verb function”. Or, if we put this in a way that is easy to understand, this is saying, “all spoken constructs related with verb function must either be the past tense or must be the future tense or must be the present tense.”
bdag gzhan dbye bas de tsam du/ / khyab pa min yang byed po dang / / bya yul bsdu phyir dbye ba de/ / mdzad nas bdag gzhan dang 'brel ba'i/ / bya byed rnams kyang de khongs bsdus/ /

“The distinction of self-other does not Pervade simply that but is a distinction made In order to include agent and place of action, One which also includes the action and agent Related as self and other within it.”

zhes pa/ bdag gzhan gyi dbye bas byed las dang 'brel ba'i ngag gi sbyor ba thams cad la dus gsum gyi dbye bas khyab pa de tsam du ma khyab kyang / 'o na gang la ma khyab ce na/ gdugs su 'khyir/ chur 'khyil/ lta bu 'di rnams la dus gsum gyi dbye bas khyab kyang bdag gzhan gyi dbye bas ma khyab pa ste bdag gzhan gyi dbye ba'i khongs su ma gtogs so/ / bdag gzhan gyi dbye ba mdzad pa'i dgos pa ni/ sgrub pa po/ bsgrub bya'i lha/ lta bu byed pa po dang bya yul gnyis bsdu ba'i phyir du dbye ba de mdzad nas/ de'i zhar la bdag gzhan dang 'brel ba'i bya byed kyi tshig phan tshun shed mtshungs pa rnams kyang de khongs bsdus zhes pa'o/ /

This is saying, “The distinction of self-other does not pervade simply that, the distinction of three tenses pervading every spoken construct connected with verb function. Well then, we could ask, “Where does it not pervade?” In cases like གདུགས་སུ་འཁྱིར། “twirling the umbrella”, ཆུར་འཁྱིལ། “water swirling” the distinction of three tenses pervades but the distinction of self-other does not; thus it is not incorporated within the distinction of self-other. The point of making the self-other distinction is: it is a distinction made for cases like སྒྲུབ་པ་པོ། “accomplisher” and བསྒྲུབ་བྱའི་ལྷ། “deity to be accomplished” where it is made in order to include both the agent and place of the action. And, appended to that, the respective, equivalent-force words for the action and agent in self-other relationship are also included within that.”

bya byed kyi sgra shed mtshungs bdag gzhan gyi khongs su bsdu tshul ji ltar yin snyam na/ sgrub par byed/ ces pa'i tshig 'di sgrub pa po zhes pa dang shed mtshungs yin pas bdag gzhan gnyis kyi nang nas bdag gi khongs su bsdus/ bsgrub par bya/ zhes pa 'di bsgrub bya'i lha zhes pa dang shed mtshungs yin pas bdag gzhan gnyis kyi nang nas gzhan gyi khongs su bsdus/ yang bdag gzhan gyi dbye ba ma mdzad na cir 'gyur snyam na/ ma mdzad na skyon 'di ltar/ dper na/ skal ldan gyis sangs rgyas bsgrubs lta bu'i tshe/ bsgrubs zhes pa'i tshig kho nas dus 'das pa go nus kyang / skal ldan dang sangs rgyas de ji lta bu yin nam snyam pa'i dogs pa 'byung ba'i skyon yod/ bdag gzhan gyi dbye ba mdzad pas skal ldan de bdag byed po dang / sangs rgyas bsgrub par bya ba gzhan de yin pa bde blag tu go ba'i dgos pa yod pas de'i phyir bdag gzhan gyi dbye ba mdzad do/ /

You might think, “How do the equivalent-force terms of the action and agent get included within self-other?”. The wording “སྒྲུབ་པར་བྱེད་” is equivalent in force to “སྒྲུབ་པ་པོ་” so out of the two self and other, it has been included within self. The wording “བསྒྲུབ་པར་བྱ་” is equivalent in force to “བསྒྲུབ་བྱའི་ལྷ་” so out of the two self and other, it has been included in other.
Then, if you might think, “If the distinction of self-other were not made, what would happen?”. If it were not made, there would be kind of problem, for example, in སྐལ་ལྡན་གྱིས་སངས་རྒྱས་བསྒྲུབས་ལྟ་བུའི་ཚེ། “at such time as fortunate ones have accomplished buddhahood” the word “བསྒྲུབས་” alone can convey the past tense, there is the problem that the doubt, “how is it with སྐལ་ལྡན་ ‘fortunate ones’ and how is it སངས་རྒྱས་ ‘buddhahood’?” will occur. Making the distinction of self-other results in སྐལ་ལྡན་ ‘fortunate ones’ being the agent in self and སངས་རྒྱས་ ‘buddhahood’ being the action that will have been accomplished in other. That has the needed, ease of comprehension to it, so, therefore, the distinction of self-other is made.

des na dus gsum du dbye ba/ / bdag gzhan dbye bas ma khyab pa/ / bsdu ba'i don du shes dgos par/ / gsungs kyang sngon 'jug 'a yig skabs/ / byed las tsam dang 'brel ba yi/ / dngos po bdag la'ang 'jug pa mthong / /

“Thus it has been stated that the distinction Into three tenses not being pervaded by The distinction into self-other is to be Understood as the meaning of inclusion. Still, in the case of the prefix ’a letter, Affixation also to the self thing Connected with mere verb function is seen.”

zhes pa/ des na 'das pa/ ma 'ongs pa/ da lta ba bcas dus gsum du dbye ba'i dgos pa ni/ bdag gzhan gyi dbye bas ma khyab pa'am ma bsdus pa lcags gser du gyur lta bu dus 'das pa dang / chu 'khyil bar 'gyur lta bu dus ma 'ongs pa dang / gdugs 'khyil gyin 'dug/ 'khyir bzhin pa'o/ / lta bu dus da lta ba rnams su bsdu ba'i don du shes dgos par gsungs kyang sngon 'jug 'a yig skabs byed las tsam dang 'brel ba yi/ chos 'chad pa po/ 'chad par byed/ lta bu dngos po bdag la'ang 'jug pa mthong ngo / / zhes pa'o/ /

This is saying, “Thus, it has been stated that the need for the division into three tenses of past, future, and present is that it is not pervaded by, that is to say, does not include, the division into self- other which inclusion is to be understood as meaning inclusion in the past tense as in ལྕགས་གསེར་དུ་གྱུར་ “iron turned into gold”, the future tense as in ཆུ་འཁྱིལ་བར་འགྱུར་ “water will swirl”, and the present tense as in གདུག་འཁྱིལ་གྱིན་འདུག “twirling the umbrella”, འཁྱིར་བཞིན་ པའོ། “twirling”. Still, in the case of the prefix ’a letter, affixation also with the self thing related with mere verb function, as in ཆོས་འཆད་པ་པོ། “expositer of dharma” and འཆད་པར་བྱེད། “expositer”, is seen.”
de ltar nges nas pho yig ba/ /
“That ascertained, male letter ba is affixed …”
zhes pa/ bshad ma thag pa de ltar tshul bzhin nges nas sngon 'jug gi pho yig ba ni/ dus 'das pa dang / gzhan gnyis la 'jug pa'i dper brjod ni/ zhes pa'o/ /
This is saying, “Now that the correct approach, just explained, has been ascertained, the prefix male letter ba is affixed for both past tense and other. To give examples …”.
bsgrubs so lta bu 'das pa dang / /
“For the past as in བསྒྲུབས་སོ། and …”
zhes pa/ bsgrubs so/ / bkang / bcad/ lta bu 'di rnams dus 'das pa yin pas des mtshon nas rgya cher shes par bya'o/ /
For the past as in བསྒྲུབས་སོ། བཀང་། བཅད།. Now that it has been illustrated with those, you should go on to learn it more extensively.
bsgrub bya'i lha dang bsgrub par bya/ / zhes sogs dngos po gzhan la 'jug/
“For other thing as in བསྒྲུབ་བྱའི་ལྷ་, བསྒྲུབ་པར་བྱ་, and so on.”
ces pa/ pho yig ba bsgrub bya'i lha sogs dngos po gzhan la 'jug pa'i dpe ni/ bsgrub bya/ bsgrub par bya ba/ bsgrub bya'i lha/ bcag bya/ bcag par bya/ bcag bya'i rdo/ lta bu/
The male letter as in བསྒྲུབ་བྱའི་ལྷ་, བསྒྲུབ་པར་བྱ་ and so on, is affixed for other thing, examples of which are བསྒྲུབ་བྱ། བསྒྲུབ་པར་བྱ་བ། བསྒྲུབ་ བྱའི་ལྷ། བཅག་བྱ། བཅག་པར་བྱ། བཅག་བྱའི་རྡོ།.
ma ning ga da gnyis po ni/ /
“Neutral two ga and da are affixed”
zhes pa/ sngon 'jug ma ning ga dang da gnyis po ni dngos po bdag dang / dngos po gzhan dang / dus da lta ba bcas gsum la 'jug pa las
Prefix neutral ga and da both are affixed for three meanings: self thing, other thing, and present tense.
dang po dngos po bdag la 'jug pa ni/
—First, the affixation for self thing:
gcod pa po dang gcod par byed/ / gcod par 'gyur dang dkri ba po/ / dkri bar byed dang dkri bar 'gyur/ / zhes sogs dngos po bdag don dang / /
“Neutral two ga and da are affixed In གཅོད་པ་པོ་ and གཅོད་པར་བྱེད་, And གཅོད་པར་འགྱུར་ and དཀྲི་བ་པོ་, And དཀྲི་བར་བྱེད་ and དཀྲི་བར་འགྱུར་, And so on to mean self thing and …”

zhes pa/ shing gcod pa po/ gcod byed/ gcod par byed/ gcod par 'gyur ro/ / snal ma dkri ba po/ dkri bar byed/ dkri bar 'gyur/ gsod pa po/ gsod par byed/ rgya mtsho dkrug pa po/ dkrug par byed/ lta bu dngos po bdag gsal byed kyi don du go bar bya'o/ /

It is to understood to mean the distinguishing mark of self thing, as in ཤིང་གཅོད་པ་པོ། གཅོད་བྱེད། གཅོད་པར་བྱེད། གཅོད་པར་འགྱུར་རོ། སྣ ་མ་དཀྲི་བ་པོ། དཀྲི་བར་བྱེད། དཀྲི་བར་འགྱུར། ག ོད་པ་པོ། ག ོད་ པར་བྱེད། རྒྱ་མཚོ་དཀྲུག་པ་པོ། དཀྲུག་པར་བྱེད།.
gnyis pa/
—Second,
gcad bya'i shing dang gcad par bya/ / dkri bya'i snal ma dkri bar bya/ / zhes sogs dngos po gzhan don dang / /
“In གཅད་བྱའི་ཤིང་ and གཅད་པར་བྱ་, And དཀྲི་བྱའི་སྣལ་མ་དཀྲི་བར་བྱ་ , And so on to mean other thing and …”
zhes pa/ ma ning ga da gnyis gcad bya'i shing sogs dngos po gzhan don du 'jug pa ni/ gsad bya/ gsad par bya ba/ gsad bya'i lug/ dgag bya/ dgag par bya ba/ dgag bya'i skyon/ lta bu/
Neutral two ga and da in གཅད་བྱའི་ཤིང་, and so on are affixed for the meaning of other thing as in གསད་བྱ། གསད་པར་བྱ་བ། གསད་བྱའི་ལུག དགག་བྱ། དགག་པར་བྱ་བ། དགག་བྱའི་སྐྱོན།.
gsum pa/
—Third,
gcod bzhin pa dang dkri bzhin pa/ / zhes sogs da lta sgrub ched 'jug/
“In གཅོད་བཞིན་པ་ and དཀྲི་བཞིན་པ་ And so on, to produce the present.”

ces pa/ ma ning ga da gnyis byed pa po gzhan dang dngos su 'brel ba'i bya ba byed bzhin pa da lta bar 'jug pa ni/ shing gcod bzhin pa/ gcod kyin 'dug/ snal ma dkri bzhin pa/ dkri yin 'dug/ don gnyer bzhin pa/ gnyer gyin 'dug/ zho dkrog bzhin pa/ dkrog pa'i sgang yin/ lta bu byed las gsal byed kyi sgra tshig grogs kyis bsgyur ba 'di rnams da lta ba bsgrub pa'i ched du 'jug go/ mo yig 'a ni bdag dngos dang / bdag don phal pa dang / dus da lta ba dang / ma 'ongs pa bcas bzhi la 'jug/

Neutral two ga and da are affixed for the present where the action of agent in actual relationship with other is being done. They are affixed to make the present where the verb’s term is modified by a phrase assistive, as in ཤིང་གཅོད་བཞིན་པ། གཅོད་ཀྱིན་འདུག སྣལ་མ་དཀྲི་བཞིན་པ། དཀྲི་ཡིན་འདུག །དོན་གཉེར་བཞིན་པ། གཉེར་གྱིན་འདུག །ཞོ་དཀྲོག་བཞིན་པ། དཀྲོག་པའི་སྒང་ཡིན།. Female letter ’a is affixed for four meanings: self thing; self as complement; present tense; and future.
dang po bdag dngos ni/
—First, the self thing,
mo yig 'a ni 'chad pa po/ / 'chad par byed dang 'chad par 'gyur/ / zhes sogs dngos po bdag dngos dang / /
“Female letter ’a is affixed in འཆད་པ་པོ་, And འཆད་པར་བྱེད་ and འཆད་པར་འགྱུར་, And so on for thing of self thing and …”
zhes pa/ chos 'chad pa po/ 'chad par byed/ 'chad par 'gyur/ mdud pa 'grol ba po/ 'grol byed/ 'grol bar 'gyur/ de sogs dngos po bdag yin pas de bsgrub pa'i phyir 'jug go/
These—ཆོས་འཆད་པ་པོ། འཆད་པར་བྱེད། འཆད་པར་འགྱུར། མདུད་པ་འགྲོལ་བ་པོ། འགྲོལ་བྱེད། འགྲོལ་བར་འགྱུར།—and so on are self thing; it is affixed in order to make that.
gnyis pa bdag don phal pa ni/
—Second, the self as complement,
'gro ba po dang 'gro bar byed/ / ces sogs bdag don phal pa dang / /
“In འགྲོ་བ་པོ་ and འགྲོ་བར་བྱེད་ And so on for the meaning of self as complement and …”

zhes pa/ mo yig bdag don phal pa la 'jug pa'i dpe ni/ lam du 'gro ba po/ 'gro bar byed/ 'gro bar 'gyur ro/ / mgo 'khor ba po/ 'khor byed/ phyogs shar nas 'char ba po/ 'char byed/ 'od 'tsher ba po/ 'tsher byed/ sogs bya byed ngo bo gcig pa'am tha mi dad par snang ba'i bdag don phal pa la 'jug go/

The female letter is affixed for self as complement, examples of which are གང་དུ་འགྲོ་བ་པོ། འགྲོ་བར་བྱེད། འགྲོ་བར་འགྱུར་རོ། །མགོ་འཁོར་བ་པོ། འཁོར་བྱེད། ཕྱོགས་ཤར་ནས་འཆར་བ་པོ། འཆར་བྱེད། འོད་འཚེར་བ་པོ། འཚེར་བྱེད།. It is affixed in these and others like them for self as complement where the action and agent appear to be the same entity or non-transitive.
gsum pa dus da lta ba ni/
—Third, the present tense,
'khyil lo zhes sogs da lta ba/ /
“In འཁྱིལ་ལོ་ and so on for the present …”

zhes pa/ chu 'khyil lo/ /'khyil bzhin pa/ gdan la 'khod bzhin pa/ 'khod mus yin/ me 'bar bzhin pa/ bde bar 'tsho bzhin pa/ sogs bdag gzhan gyi dbye bas ma bsdus pa'i dus da lta ba bsgrub pa'i phyir 'jug pa'o/ /

It is affixed as in ཆུ་འཁྱིལ་ལོ། །འཁྱིལ་བཞིན་པ། གདན་ལ་འཁོད་བཞིན་པ། འཁོད་མུས་ཡིན། མེ་འབར་བཞིན་པ། བདེ་བར་འཚོ་བཞིན་པ། and so on, in order to produce the present tense not included by the distinction into self-other.
bzhi pa dus ma 'ongs pa ni/
—Fourth, the future tense,
'khyil bar 'gyur sogs ma 'ongs 'jug/
“And in འཁྱི ་བར་འགྱུར་ and so on for the future.”
ces pa/ chu 'khyil bar 'gyur/ sman 'ju bar 'gyur/ lus 'tsho bar 'gyur/ de la sogs pa bya byed tha mi dad du snang ba'i bya ba byed 'gyur ma 'ongs pa bsgrub pa'i phyir 'jug go/

It is affixed as in ཆུ་འཁྱིལ་བར་འགྱུར། སྨན་འཇུ་བར་འགྱུར། ལུས་འཚོ་བར་འགྱུར། and so on, in order to produce the intransitive future that is, an action that will happen where the action and agent appear not to be different, that is, intransitive.
shin tu mo yi ma yig ni/ / bdag gzhan dus gsum mnyam par 'jug/
“The extremely female letter ma Is affixed equally for self, other, and the three tenses.”

ces pa/ sngon 'jug gi shin tu mo ma yig ni bdag gzhan gnyis dang dus gsum ste thams cad la mnyam par 'jug/ de yang bdag la 'jug pa ni/ mkhyen pa po/ mkhas par byed/ lta bu/ gzhan la 'jug pa ni/ mkhas bya/ mchod bya/ mchod par bya/ lta bu/ dus 'das pa la 'jug pa ni/ mkhyen to/ / mkhas par byas/ mgu bar byas/ lta bu/ dus da lta bar 'jug pa ni/ mkhyen bzhin pa/ mjal bzhin pa/ mthun gyin 'dug/ lta bu/ ma 'ongs pa la 'jug pa ni/ mkhas par 'gyur/ mdza' bar 'gyur/ mthun par 'gyur/ lta bu kun la mnyam par 'jug go/

The prefix extremely female ma letter is affixed equally for both self and other and the three tenses that is, for everything. To add to that, it is affixed for self as in མཁྱེན་པ་པོ། མཁས་པར་བྱེད།; for other as in མཁས་བྱ། མཆོད་བྱ། མཆོད་པར་བྱ།; for the past tense as in མཁྱེན་ཏོ། །མཁས་པར་བྱ ། མགུ་བར་བྱ །; for the present tense as in མཁྱེན་བཞིན་པ། མཇལ་བཞིན་པ། མཐུན་གྱིན་འདུག; for the future tense as in མཁས་པར་འགྱུར། མཛའ་བར་འགྱུར། མཐུན་པར་འགྱུར།. That is, it is used for all of those.
'on kyang byed po gzhan dngos dang / / 'brel ba'i 'das la 'a'i sngon 'jug/ med par nges shing ga da nyung / /
“Nonetheless, for the past of an agent in actual Relationship with other, the ’a prefix Certainly not and ga and da a little.”
zhes pa/ 'on kyang byed po gzhan dang dngos su 'brel ba'i 'das tshig rnams la 'a'i sngon 'jug med par nges shing / der ma zad ga da gnyis kyang nyung bar yod do zhes pa'o/ /

This is saying, “Nonetheless, it is certain that the ’a prefix is never affixed for past forms of agent in actual relationship with other, and not only that but that both ga and da also are affixed only a little”.
da lta ba la ba'i sngon 'jug/ nyung zhing mgo can da lta bar/ / bas 'phul med par nges pa tsam/ /
“For the present, the prefix ba A little and for headed present Not having ba fronted is simpl y certain.”
zhes pa/ da lta ba'i tshig rnams la ba yig gi sngon 'jug nyung bar ma zad/ ra la sa'i mgo can da lta ba rnams la yang ba 'phul med par nges pa tsam yin/ zhes pa'o/ /
This is saying, “Present forms have the ba letter prefix only a little and not only that but also for present forms with ra, la, or sa heads it is simply certain that they do not have a ba fronted.”
gzhan yang bas 'phul can phal cher/ / byed pa po ni da lta dang / / bya yul ma 'ongs par bsdus nas/ /
“Not having ba fronted is simply certain. Furthermore, for ba fronted forms usually The agent is included in the present and …”

zhes pa/ gzhan yang ba'i 'phul rten can phal cher byed pa po dang / bya yul gnyis las byed pa po ni da lta ba'i khongs dang / bya yul ma 'ongs pa'i khongs su bsdus nas dus 'das pa dang / da lta ba dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / skul tshig bcas bzhi ru dbye bar bya'o/ /

Furthermore, ba fronted forms usually incorporate, of the two agent and place of action, the agent in the present and the place of action in the future. Thus, this makes a division into four of past tense, present tense, future tense, and the imperative form.
dang po ni/
—First,
'das la bas 'phul yang 'jug yod/ /
“The past has ba fronting and re-suffix …”
ces pa/ mgo can 'das tshig rnams la ba sogs sngon 'jug dang yang 'jug gnyis ka 'jug ste/ dper na/ lha bsgoms/ lta bu/
Headed, past-form words have prefixes—ba and so on—and re- suffixes both affixed on them, for example, as in ལྷ་བསྒོམས།.
gnyis pa ni/
—Second,
da lta ba la gnyis ka med/ /
“The present has neither of the two …”
ces pa/ da lta ba'i tshig rnams la sngon 'jug yang 'jug gang yang mi 'jug pa'i dpe ni/ sgrub pa po/ sgrub byed/ sgrub par byed/ sgrub bo/ / lta bu/
Present forms have neither prefix nor re-suffix at all, for example སྒྲུབ་པ་པོ། སྒྲུབ་བྱེད། སྒྲུབ་པར་བྱེད། སྒྲུབ་པོ།.
gsum pa/
—Third,
ma 'ongs 'phul yod yang 'jug med/ /
“The future has a fronting and no re-suffix and …”
ces pa/ ma 'ongs pa'i tshig rnams la 'phul yod yang 'jug med pa'i dpe ni/ bsgrub bya/ bsgrub par bya/ bsgrub bya'i lha/ lta bu/
Future forms have a fronting and do not have a re-suffix, for example, བསྒྲུབ་བྱ། བསྒྲུབ་པར་བྱ། བསྒྲུབ་བྱའི་ལྷ།.
bzhi pa skul tshig rnams
—Fourth, imperative forms
['di] la yang 'jug yod med gnyis/
both have and do not have re- suffixes.
dang po yod pa ni/
—1. Having re-suffix:
skul tshig 'phul med yang 'jug yod/ /
“The imperative has no fronting and has a re-suffix.”
ces pa/ skul tshig rnams la 'phul rten sngon 'jug med cing / yang 'jug yod pa'i dpe ni/ sgrubs shig/ srungs shig/ lta bu/
There are imperative forms without a fronting prefix and with a re- suffix, for example སྒྲུབས་ཤིག སྲུངས་ཤིག.
gnyis pa yang 'jug med pa ni/
—2. Not having re-suffix:
skabs 'gar 'das dang skul tshig la/ / sa rkyang sbyar bas 'thus pa'ang yod/ /
“Sometimes past and imperative having A bare sa connected to them is also acceptable.”

ces pa/ 'das tshig dang skul tshig phal cher la yang 'jug thob kyang / skabs 'gar 'das pa dang skul tshig gnyis la sa rkyang sbyar bas 'thus pa ste chog pa'ang yod de/ 'das pa la sa rkyang sbyar bas 'thus pa ni/ byas/ 'das/ bltas/ lta bu/ skul tshig la sa rkyang sbyar bas 'thus pa ni/ gyis shig/ ltos shig/ skus/ lta bu/

Past and imperative word-forms usually get a re-suffix, however sometimes both past and imperative can have a bare sa connected which is also acceptable, that is, allowable. Past word forms for which the connection of a bare sa is acceptable are as in བྱས། འདས། བལྟས། and imperative forms as in གྱིས་ཤིག ལྟོས་ཤིག སྐུས།.
4. The explanation of the divisions of the gender signs of the suffixes
rjes 'jug yi ge bcu po yi/ / ga da ba sa bzhi rnams pho/ / nga ma 'a gsum mo yin cing / / na ra la gsum ma ning ste/ / ming gzhi'i yi ge kun la 'jug/
“Of the ten suffix letters, The four ga da ba sa are male, The three nga ma and ’a are female, And the three na ra and la are neutral; They affix to all name-base letters.”

ces pa/ rjes 'jug gi rtags kyi dbye ba bshad pa ste/ ga nga da na ba ma 'a/ / ra la sa rnams rjes 'jug bcu/ / zhes pa ltar rjes 'jug yi ge bcu po de rnams la nang gses dbye na gsum du yod/ gsum gang zhe na/ pho dang / mo dang / ma ning ste gsum du 'gyur ro/ / dang po ni/ ga dang / da dang / ba dang / sa bcas bzhi ni pho yig go/ gnyis pa/ nga dang / ma dang / 'a bcas gsum ni mo yig go/ gsum pa/ na dang / ra dang / la bcas gsum ni ma ning gi yi ge'o/ / de rnams ming gzhi'i yi ge kun la 'jug pa yin no/ / zhes pa'o/ /

This is saying, “The ten suffixes as mentioned in “ga nga da na ba ma ’a ra la and sa are the ten suffixes” divide into three sub- divisions. What are the three? They are male, female, and neutral. First, the four ga, da, ba, and sa are male letters. Second, the three nga, ma, and ’a are female letters. Third, the three na, ra, and la are neutral letters. They, all of them, affix to all name-base letters.”
5. The explanation of how the gender signs of the suffixes affi
ji ltar 'jug tshul gnyis yin te/ /
“How they affix has two parts:”
zhes pa/ rjes 'jug gi rtags kyi 'jug tshul bshad pa ste rjes 'jug rnams ji ltar 'jug pa'i tshul la gnyis yod pa yin te/ sgra'i 'jug tshul dang / don gyi 'jug tshul gnyis las/
There are two parts to the way in which suffixes affix: how they are affixed in connection with sound; and how they are affixed in connection with meaning.
dang po [sgra'i 'jug tshul] ni/
5.A. The explanation of how the gender signs of the suffixes affix in relation to sound
dang po sgra yi 'jug tshul ni/ /
“First, the way of affixation in relation to sound.”

zhes pa/ dang po sgra yi 'jug tshul de la yang rjes 'jug pho gsum ni ming gzhi'i yi ge gang la zhugs kyang brjod pa'i sgra gdangs drag par 'jug pa dang / mo gnyis ni sgra gdangs zhan par 'jug pa dang / ma ning gsum ni bar ma ste sgra gdangs ran par 'jug pa yin no/ / pho la yang nang gses sgra rtsol drag pa rnams skyes bu rab dang / de las cung zad zhan pa bar ma rnams skyes bu 'bring dang / de las kyang shin tu zhan pa skyes bu tha ma ste gsum du yod pa'i dang po ni/

For the three male suffixes, no matter which name-base letter they are affixed to, a vocalization of stronger sound is used; for the two females, a weaker sound is used, and for the three neutrals an intermediate, that is, a moderate sound is used.
The males in addition have the three sub-divisions of “strongest being” which is the ones of stronger sound effort, “the middling being” which is the intermediate ones slightly weaker than that; and “weakest being” which is the ones weaker again, the extremely weak ones. The first of those categories is this:
pho yi ga yig yang 'jug can/ / skyes bu rab dang /
“The male ga letter having a re-suffix Is strongest being; …”
zhes pa/ rjes 'jug gi pho ga yig la yang 'jug sa zhugs na skyes bu rab yin te/ dper na/ mdo bklags/ don gzigs/ lta bu dang /
If the suffix male ga letter has a re-suffix sa in place, it is the best being, for example མདོ་བཀླགས། དོན་གཟིགས།. Then,
pho yig ba/ / yang 'jug can rnams skyes bu 'bring / /
“… male letter ba Having a re-suffix is middling being;”
zhes pa/ pho yig ba yang 'jug dang 'brel na skyes bu 'bring yin te/ dper na/ skyabs/ bsgrubs/ stobs/ lta bu'o/ /
Male letter ba with a re-suffix connected is middling being for example སྐྱབས། བསྒྲུབས། སྟོབས།.
ga ba yang 'jug med pa dang / / da sa'i mtha' can tha ma ste/ /
“And endings ga and ba without re-suffix Or with an ending of da or sa are weakest.”

zhes pa/ ga dang ba gnyis yang 'jug med pa dang / da sa'i mtha' can te da dang sa rjes 'jug tu yod pa rnams skyes bu tha ma yin te/ dper na/ bdag/ mchog/ khab/ rab/ yod/ bstod/ skyes/ bzhes/ lta bu'o/ /

Name bases having the endings of the two letters ga and ba without re-suffix and those having the endings of da and sa, that is, having da and sa suffixed to them, are least being, e.g., བདག མཆོག ཁབ། རབ། ཡོད། བསྟོད། སྐྱེས། བཞེས།.
drag pa pho la'ang nang gses kyis/ / drag zhan bar ma gsum du dbye/ /
“The strong males also are divided into Three sub-divisions of stronger, weaker, intermediate.”
zhes pa/ drag pa pho'i yi ge la'ang nang gses kyis drag pa skyes bu rab dang / bar ma skyes bu 'bring dang / zhan pa skyes bu tha ma ste bshad ma thag pa bzhin gsum du 'gyur ro/ /

The stronger male letters also divide into three sub-divisions like in the immediately preceding explanation: stronger ones are greatest being; intermediate ones, middling being; and weaker ones, weakest being.
de bzhin zhan pa mo la yang / / nang gses drag zhan gnyis dbye ste/ /
“Similarly, the weak females also are divided into The two sub-divisions of stronger and weaker;”
zhes pa/ pho la skyes bu gsum du dbye ba de bzhin du zhan pa mo la yang nang gses drag pa mo dang / zhan pa shin tu mo ste gnyis su dbye ste/
Similar to the sub-division of males into three beings, the weaker females also are divided into the two sub-divisions of stronger female and weaker extremely female;
nga ma yang 'jug can mo dang / /
“Nga and ma with re-suffix are female …”
zhes pa/ nga dang / ma gnyis yang 'jug can rnams drag pa mo tsam yin te/ dper na/ bzhengs/ gangs/ dbyings/ byams/ bsgoms/ rnams/ lta bu'o/ / gnyis pa/
Nga and ma both having a re-suffix are the stronger one, the just female, for example as in བཞེངས། གངས། དབྱིངས། བྱམས། བསྒོམས། རྣམས།. And secondly,
nga ma yang 'jug med pa dang / / 'a mtha' can rnams shin tu mo/ /
“And nga and ma without re-suffix Or with ’a ending are extremely female.”

zhes pa/ nga dang ma gnyis yang 'jug med pa dang / 'a dang bcas gsum po rnams kyi mtha' can te rjes 'jug ni shin tu mo yin pa'i dpe ni/ mthong / zhing / gsum/ gtam/ bka'/ dga'/ mkha'/ mda'/ lta bu'o/ /
the three suffix endings of nga and ma without re-suffix and of ’a are extremely female, examples of which are: མཐོང་། ཞིང་། གསུམ། གཏམ། བཀའ། དགའ། མཁའ། མདའ།.

bar ma ma ning na ra la/ / yang 'jug yod dam med kyang rung / / ming gzhi pho yig mthar yod dang / / ming gzhi ma ning rjes su ni/ / yang 'jug dang bcas zhugs pa na/ / drag dang 'phrad pas drag par 'gyur/ /

“Intermediate neutral na, ra, la, Affixed at the end of a name-base male letter Whether there is a re-suffix or not, and Affixed after a neutral name-base When there is a re-suffix, Are in contact with stronger, so change to stronger.”

zhes pa/ sgra gdangs bar ma ma ning na ra la gsum po 'di la yang 'jug yod dam med kyang rung ming gzhi pho yig gi mthar yod pa dang / ming gzhi ma ning gi rjes su yang 'jug dang bcas te zhugs pa na sgra gdangs drag pa dang 'phrad pa yin pas drag par 'gyur te/ dper na ming gzhi pho yig dang 'phrad pa ni/ kun/ dkon/ bkar/ bkol/ skul/ can/ gcerd/ bcold/ gtan/ bstand/ dpon/ spar/ dpal/ speld/ brtson/ btsird/ bstsald/ sogs so/ / ming gzhi ma ning gi rjes su yang 'jug dang bcas zhugs pa ni/ 'khond/ chard/ thard/ phuld/ tshard/ lta bu drag dang 'phrad pas drag par 'gyur ba'o/ / 'di skabs si dngul gnyis cung mi 'dra ba 'dug/

The intermediate vocalization of these three neutrals na, ra, and la, when they are affixed at the end of a name-base male letter whether they have a re-suffix on them or not, and when they are affixed after a neutral name-base together with a re-suffix, is in contact with a stronger vocalization, so it changes to stronger. For example, when in contact with a male letter name-base as in ཀུན། དཀོན། བཀར། བཀོལ། སྐྱལ། ཅན། གཅེརད། བཅོལད། གཏན། བསྟནད། དཔོན། སྤར། དཔལ། སྤེལད། བརྩོན། བཙིརད། སྩལད། and so on, and after a neutral name-base together with re-suffix, as in འཁོནད། ཆརད། ཐརད། ཕུལད། ཚརད། the contact is with stronger, so they change to stronger. Here, Situ and Ngul differ a little.
ming gzhi mo yig rjes su ni/ / yang 'jug med par zhugs pa na/ / zhan dang 'phrad pas zhan par 'gyur/ /
“Affixed after a name-base female letter When there is no re-suffix, They are in contact with weaker, so change to weaker.”

zhes pa/ na ra la gsum ming gzhi mo yig gi rjes su ni yang 'jug med par zhugs pa na zhan dang 'phrad pas zhan par 'gyur te/ dper na/ 'gran/ 'gor/ mgul/ ljon/ 'jur/ mjal/ don/ 'bar/ 'dzul/ gzhon/ zur/ 'ol/ g.yon/ bshor/ gsal/ sogs so/ /

The three na, ra, la when affixed after a name-base female letter and without a re-suffix, have come into contact with weaker, so they change to weaker. For example, འགྲན། འགོར། མགུལ། ལྗོན། འཇུར། མཇལ། དོན། འབར། འཛུལ། གཞོན། ཟུར། འོལ། གཡོན། བཤོར། གསལ།, and so on.
de gnyis 'gyur ba ma ning yin/ /
“Those two are changeable neutral.”

zhes pa/ gong gi drag zhan gnyis po de 'gyur ba ma ning ste 'gyur ba zhes pa'i don ni ming gzhi drag pa dang 'phrad na drag pa dang / ming gzhi zhan pa dang 'phrad na zhan par 'gyur ba ste rang gso mi zin pas na 'gyur ba zhes brjod pa yin no/ /

The above two, stronger and weaker, are changeable neutral. The meaning of “changeable” is that if they come into contact with a stronger name-base, they change to stronger and if a weaker one, they change to weaker so, not maintaining their own form, they are spoken of as “changeable”.
ming gzhi mo yig rjes su ni/ / yang 'jug dang bcas zhugs pa na/ / drag zhan gnyis ka'i cha ldan phyir/ / mtshan gnyis ma ning zhes su grags/ /
“Affixed after a name-base female letter When there is a re-suffix, Because they have both stronger and weaker factors, They are known as “dual-character neutral”.”

zhes pa/ na ra la gsum ming gzhi mo yig gi rjes su yang 'jug dang bcas te zhugs pa na drag zhan gnyis ka'i cha dang ldan pa'i phyir/ mtshan gnyis ma ning zhes su grags pa yin te/ dper na/ bsgard/ brgald/ 'jald/ dond/ dbend/ 'dzard/ bzhard/ zind/ zurd/ 'o+ond/ g.yuld/ shard/ gsold/ lta bu ming gzhi mo yig dang 'phrad pas mo'i cha dang ldan/ yang 'jug pho yig dang 'phrad pas pho'i cha dang ldan pas mtshan gnyis dang / rjes 'jug kho rang ma ning yin pas mtshan gnyis ma ning zhes brjod do/ /

The three na, ra, la when affixed after a name-base female letter and with a re-suffix, because of having both stronger and weaker portions, are known as “dual-character neutral”. For example in བསྒརད། བརྒལད། འཇལད། དོནད། དབེནད། འཛརད། བཞརད། ཟིནད། ཟུརད། འོནད། གཡུལད། ཤརད། གསོལད།, they are in with a name-base female letter so have a female portion and are in contact with a re-suffix male letter so have a male portion thus they have both characters, and since the suffixes themselves are neutral, they are spoken of as “dual-character neutral”.
ming gzhi ma ning rjes su ni/ / yang 'jug med par zhugs pa na/ / drag zhan gang du'ang mi 'gyur bas/ / mtshan med ma ning zhes su 'dod/ /
“Affixed after a name-base neutral name-base When there is no re-suffix, There is no change at all to stronger or weaker, So they are asserted to be “characterless neutral”.”

ces pa/ ming gzhi ma ning kha cha tha pha tsha lnga'i rjes su ni yang 'jug med par zhugs pa na drag zhan gang du'ang mi 'gyur te/ dper na/ mkhan/ 'khor/ khal/ chen/ 'char/ 'chal/ mthun/ thur/ mthol/ phan/ 'phur/ 'phel/ tshon/ tshur/ 'tshol/ lta bu ming gzhi dang rjes 'jug gnyis ka ma ning yin cing pho mo'i mtshan ma gang yang med pas mtshan med ma ning zhes su 'dod do/ /

When affixed after the five name-base neutrals kha, cha, tha, pha, and tsha without a re-suffix, there are no changes to stronger or weaker anywhere. For example in མཁན། འཁོར། ཁལ། ཆེན། འཆར། འཆལ། མཐུན། ཐུར། འཐོལ། ཕན། འཕུར། འཕེལ། ཚོན། ཚུར། འཚོལ། since both name-base and suffix are neutral and since there is no male or female gender whatsoever, they are held to be “characterless neutral”.
gnyis pa [don gyi 'jug tshul] ni/
5.B. The explanation of how the gender signs of the suffixes affix in relation to meaning
gnyis pa don la gnyis yod pa'i/ /
“Second, meaning, has two parts of which …”
zhes pa/ gnyis pa don gyi 'jug tshul bshad pa la gnyis/ snga ma gang ltar 'gyur ba bshad pa dang / phyi ma gang ltar 'gyur ba bshad pa'o/ /
The second one, the explanation of affixation in relation to meaning, has two parts: an explanation of how the prior one will change and of how the subsequent one will change.
dang po ni/
—1. The explanation of how the prior one changed
snga ma gang ltar 'gyur ba ni/ / rjes 'jug gang la zhugs pa yi/ / ming des bdag gzhan sogs gang ston/ /
“How the prior one will change is concerned with What the name to which the suffix is joined Will come to show—self-other, and so on …”
zhes pa/ rjes 'jug de rnams gang la zhugs pa'i ming de nyid ming mtha' sogs la ltos nas snga mar grub pa yin pas des bdag gzhan sogs gang dang gang ston pa ni/

The names themselves that the suffixes are affixed to have become, in dependence on their name-endings, the prior one. What the prior shows which of the various things of self-other, and so on is as follows.
phal cher ming de'i sngon 'jug gi/ nus par sbyar nas rtogs par bya/ /
“Which will usually be known through The capacity of the prefix joined to that name.”

zhes pa/ ming des don gang ston pa phal cher ming de'i sngon 'jug lnga las gang zhig yin pa de'i nus par sbyar nas bdag gzhan dus gsum sogs gang yin rtogs par bya dgos te/ dper na/ rjes 'jug pho bzhi ci rigs par dus 'das pa la 'jug pa/ bsgrigs/ bsgrubs/ bkag/ btab/ bshad/ brtas/ lta bu/ bdag la 'jug pa ni/ 'grogs byed/ 'debs byed/ 'gog byed/ sgrub byed/ sdud byed/ mdzes byed/ lta bu dang / de rnams gzhan la 'jug pa ni/ gdags bya/ dgag bya/ bsgrub bya/ brjod bya/ lta bu dang / bdag gzhan gyi dbye bas ma bsdus pa'i dus da lta bar 'jug pa ni/ 'phags bzhin pa/ 'jug bzhin pa/ 'grub bzhin pa/ 'khod bzhin pa/ dgyes bzhin pa/ lta bu dang / dus ma 'ongs par 'jug pa ni/ 'byid par 'gyur/ 'jib par 'gyur/ gzhug par 'gyur/ 'thob par 'gyur/ 'chad par 'gyur/ lta bu dang / des mtshon nas mo gnyis dang ma ning gsum la yang shes par bya'o/ /

The meaning that the name shows normally has to be comprehended as self-other, one of the three tenses, etcetera, whatever it is, through the capacity of whichever of the five prefixes it has had connected to it. For example, the appropriate one of the four male suffixes affixed to the past tense is as in བསྒྲིགས། བསྒྲུབས། བཏབ། བཤད། བརྟས།; and affixed to self as in འགྲོགས་བྱེད། འདེབས་བྱེད། འགོག་བྱེད། སྒྲུབ་བྱེད། སྡུད་བྱེད། མཛེས་བྱེད། ; and with other as in གདགས་བྱ། དགག་བྱ། བསྒྲུབ་བྱ། བརྗོད་བྱ།; and affixed to the present tense that does not include the distinction of self-other as in འཕགས་བཞིན་པ། འཇུག་བཞིན་པ། འགྲུབ་བཞིན་པ། འཁོད་བཞིན་པ། དགྱེས་བཞིན་པ།; and with the future tense as in འབྱིང་པར་འགྱུར། འཇིབ་པར་འགྱུར། གཞུག་པར་འགྱུར། འཐོབ་པར་འགྱུར། འཆད་པར་འགྱུར།; and then, following that illustration, the two female and three neutral suffixes should also be known.

ming rkyang tsam ni/ gdugs/ stobs/ bdag/ g.yab/ tshod/ dus/ lta bu dang / zhugs shig/ sgrubs shig/ lta bu skul tshig dang / de ltar sngon 'jug la ltos pa gtso bor gsungs pa'i zhar la sngon 'jug med kyang gong bzhin bdag gzhan sogs ston nus pa'ang shes dgos pa ni/ rtogs byed/ rtogs zin/ rtsom byed/ gleng bya/ skor bzhin pa/ ston par 'gyur/ skyobs shig/ byas/ lta bu dang / da sa'i yang 'jug gis 'das pa rang dbang du ston pa/ dper na/ gyurd/ 'das/ byas/ grags/ lta bu'o/ / de ltar sa'i 'jug gsum gyis 'das pa dang / 'a mtha' 'das pa la gtan nas mi 'jug pa'i khyad par tsam las gzhan ma 'jug yul bdag gzhan sogs gang yin tshig grogs kyis bsgyur ba'i nus par shes dgos pa yin no/ /

There is merely the name alone as in གདུགས། སྟོབས། བདག གཡབ། ཚོད། དུས། and imperative forms as in ཞུགས་ཤིག །སྒྲུབས་ཤིག and then there is the same kind of thing, which comes in addition to the principal statement above of dependence on the prefix, that it is also necessary to understand the situation of no prefix but capacity to show self-other, and so on, as above, for example in རྟོགས་བྱེད། རྟོགས་ཟིན། རྩོམ་བྱེད། གླེང་བྱ། སྐོར་བཞིན་པ། སྟོན་པར་འགྱུར། སྐྱོབས་ཤིག བྱས། and that of the da and sa re-suffixes in themselves showing the past, for example as in གྱུརད། འདས། བྱས། གྲགས།. Except for those examples of three affixations of sa producing the past and the special case of its definitely not being affixed on achung of the past, it should be understood that on other recipients with whatever meaning of self-other, etcetera, that meaning can be changed by phrasal assistives.
gnyis pa/
—2. The explanation of how the subsequent one will be changed
phyi ma ji ltar 'gyur ba ni/ /
“How the subsequent one will be changed is as follows.”
zhes pa/ phyi ma dag gi ming mtha' ji ltar 'gyur ba rnam dbye so so'i thob thang la dbye na bzhi las/
How the name endings of the subsequent ones change is dictated by the individual cases and divides up into four ways as follows.
dang po ni/
—First,
rjes 'jug pho yis pho yig gi/ ming mtha' gzhan drang / /
“Male suffix draws another male at the end of the name …”

zhes pa/ ming snga ma'i mtha'i rjes 'jug rtags gsum gang yin pa de'i ming de nyid kyi cha nas mthar sbyor dgos pa'i ming mtha' yin na rtags mthun par 'dren pa shas che bas rjes 'jug phos ming gzhi pho'i ming mtha' 'dren pa/ dper na/ rtog pa/ dpyid ka/ thad ka/ gnyis ka/ mkhyend pa/ 'byord pa/ dgongs pa/ lta bu/

The gender of the suffix at the end of that earlier name, if the name must have an ending connected that will be a new part of that name itself, uses the majority case of drawing concordant gender and hence draws a male name ending of a male name-base to a male suffix. For example as in, རྟོག་པ། དཔྱིད་ཀ ཐད་ཀ གཉིས་ཀ མཁྱེནད་པ། འབྱོརད་པ། དགོངས་པ།.
gnyis pa/
—Second,
de bzhin du/ / mo yis mo yi ming mtha' drang / /
“Female draws a female at the end of the name …”
zhes pa/ gong du rjes 'jug phos pho'i ming mtha' drangs pa de bzhin du mo yis mo'i ming mtha' drang bar bya ste/ dper na/ gsing ma/ tham ga/ snying ga/ dga' ba/ lta bu dang /
Like above, where a male suffix drew a male name ending, a female one will draw a female name ending, for example as in གསིང་མ། ཐམ་ག སྙིང་ག དགའ་བ།.
gsum pa/
—Third,
ma ning gis ni ma ning drang / /
“And neutral draws a neutral.”
zhes pa/ rjes 'jug ma ning gis ming gzhi ma ning drang bar bya ste/ dper na/ dgun kha/ dbyar kha/ spar kha/ 'phal kha/ gsal kha/ lta bu dang /
Neutral suffix will draw a neutral name base, for example དགུན་ཁ། དབྱར་ཁ། སྤར་ཁ། འཕལ་ཁ། གསལ་ཁ།.
de rnams rtags mtshungs 'dren tshul te/ /
“Those ways are the ways of equivalent gender sign being drawn..”
zhes pa/ gong gi de rnams rjes 'jug gi rtags dang ming gzhi'i rtags rtags mtshungs par 'dren tshul yin te/ zhes pa'o/ /
This is saying, “The above are the way of drawing equivalent gender of suffix and name base genders”.
bzhi pa/
—Fourth,
brjod bde 'dren pa'ang shin tu mang / /
“There are also very many cases of ease of expression being drawn.”
